dialogues.text: Darnell challenged by this, gets up and goes over to wher Ray and Autumn are standing. A slow tune plays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Autumn) Can I have this one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you so worried about? You  haven't lost your starting job yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Autumn realizes this could quickly get out of hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning to Ray) Just one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray reluctantly backs off. Darnell and Autumn start to da Several players who've picked up on the tension, watch th as they move around the floor. They try to pretend they'r just having a nice little chat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering) Take it easy, Darnell. This isn't a  good time to push things. You're  putting me in an awkward position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeh, well, I got a little  encouragement along the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That kiss... it was just... a kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit. You meant it. I wouldn't  be standing here now, everybody  thinkin' I'm a stupid asshole, if I  didn't know you meant it. I wanna  see you, Autumn. Not in study hall.  Not like your student. Like somebody  to be taken seriously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do take you seriously, Darnell,  but I'm still with Ray. I can't just  go paradin' around town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't need to go paradin'. We'll  go someplace different. Someplace  nobody'll see us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him a long beat. She doesn't need this  complication, this conflict, but she can't say no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, why am I even considering this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The song ends. Ray moves in to reclaim her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Darnell) All caught up on your arithmetic?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darnell, pissed, gives Ray a shove.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeh, you only gained 37 yards on 12  carries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray lunges back at him, but quickly several players, led Joe and Bud Lite, step between them. Darnell shrugs them and leaves the party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Bud Lite) Just what we need, a little team  unity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray takes Autumn's arm, pulls her out onto the patio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gettin' a little sick of this  asshole, Autumn. I don't like you  hangin' out with him. It's  embarrassing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't hang out with him. I tutor  him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then have him get another tutor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do that. I made a commitment  to help him pass his qualifying exam.  I can't bail out on him now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell difference does it  makes? They'll grease him through no  matter what he does. Nobody's ever  gonna see his graduation. Don't tell  me you're falling for this guy. He's  just another gang-banger with speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just said I wanted to help him.  What are you more afraid of, losing  your girl or your position?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you oughta think about what  you're in danger of losing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Autumn rips free of his grip, and walks out of the party  too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darnell sits alone on a bench under an old Willow, just  staring out at the night. He hears a voice behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So where you wanna go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns. It's Autumn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The party's still in full gear. Ray is now chatting up a of the groupies. Joe and Bud Lite sit off in a corner. Jo knocked back several beers. He's a little tipsy, and lost thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe she's out with some guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who? Camille? I don't think she's  the type to screw around on ya. Shoot  ya, maybe...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wouldn't be screwing around. It's  not like we're going together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe's gaze falls on a sultry brunette, SHERI, at a table  across the way. She's eyeing Joe big time. She wants him. stares back at her. She doesn't blink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camille, carrying an armload of books, comes down the lib steps, having been studying late. As she heads for her do she sees Joe and Sheri going across the Quad; Sheri drape around Joe, nuzzling him. Joe looks over, spots Camille, stops; surprised, embarras to see her. They exchange a look. Camille, upset, turns a wheels off. Joe wants to say something to her, but can't it out.

dialogues.speaker: ON DARNELL AND AUTUMN
dialogues.text: We don't know where yet, but they seem to be slipping and sliding, clutching on to each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right, nobody would ever see  us here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Near closing time. Darnell and Autumn lurch and stumble a the ice, collapsing against the boards now and then. Ther are few other skaters at this hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I figure the key is to go places  only white people go. Next time we'll  go bowling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Autumn laughs, as the house lights start to blink, indica it's closing time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plus I saw this in Rocky. I never  believed a guy who was supposed to  be an athlete would skate that bad,  but now I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They make their way to an opening in the boards, stumble  over to a bench, begin to unlace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, that was fun, sort of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were pretty good for the first  time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's not really my first time.  My dad took me skating once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He used to play ball for E.S.U.,  didn't he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, how'd you know that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw his picture on the Wall of  Fame. You got his eyes. Luckily, you  didn't get his thighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She laughs, looks at him a beat, starts to come forward t kiss him. He puts a finger to her lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make sure you mean it this time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hesitates a beat, then comes forward again. They fall into a deep kiss. We PULL BACK to LONGSHOT. Two people al in the expanse of the ice rink. The lights flicker and go out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camille, unable to sleep, enters in her workout clothes.  Languid, melancholy, she goes to the treadmill, as Joe co out of the steam room with nothing but a towel around his waist. Both are surprised to see the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doin' here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Couldn't sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just sweatin' out some of the  beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camille just nods. Long, silent pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't go home with her. I thought  about it... but I didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You drink too much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns, starts toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't I what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go home with her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know... I guess I figured  maybe there was somethin' goin' on  between you and me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camille hesitates, not sure whether to believe him, then  gets off the bike and walks toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why'd you pick her up in the  first place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was drunk... I needed some company.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angry) Company? Yeh, I can see you havin' a  real far-ranging discussion with  Sheri.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, ya know, physical company...  I was... I just needed to pounce on  somebody I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camille, really steamed now, snatches the towel from arou Joe's waist, leaving him naked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why can't you pounce on me? Aren't I  good enough to pounce on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camille snaps the towel at him, driving him back. Joe's  totally thrown by this reaction in her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you're more conservative...  classier... you're not that kinda  girl...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She snaps the towel again, backing him against the traini table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (insulted) How do you know? You've never slept  with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pounds on his chest, pushing him back on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What makes you think she's such a  great ride? (climbing up on top  of him) I'm prettier, my legs are longer... (pulling down her  leotard) I've got better tits. (exasperated) Why would you go to her, when you  have me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know I had you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softer, leaning close) Well you do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at her a beat, then pulls her mouth down to his. They fall into a long, white-hot kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe and Camille are making love passionately, energetical Camille, still worked up, rolls up on top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (between kisses) You shoulda looked for me at the  library, or don't you ever go there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rolling back on top) I go there. I got a 3.2 in Political  Science. I just don't go there on  Saturday nights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rolling back on top  again) I have a paper due Monday. What'de  she do? Sit on your lap or just give  you the nail-me stare?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, Camille.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe rolls back on top, the momentum carrying both of them off the table and out of sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some 100 students are taking a history test in blue books T.A., checking attendance, walks up to Louanne. She's une as the T.A. checks his chart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby Collins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I see your I.D.?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louanne knows she's in deep trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A high-tech room full of video machines and monitors used run simultaneous views of different positions during the  same play. A grim-looking group of assistant coaches  approaches Winters as he runs through and reprograms the  images on the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coach, we, ah... got a problem with  Bobby Collins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He talked... a friend... into taking  a test for him and got caught. They  had a new T.A. in there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the penalty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, the rules say automatic  expulsion for both of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fortunately, we've got friends on  the Board of Regents. I think we can  beat this if we really go to bat for  him. We got Mack off when he turned  in that other guys term paper. (shaking his head) But what kinda idiot would do  something like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I guess Bobby figured he was  gonna flunk...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't mean Bobby. I mean what kinda  guy would be dumb enough to take a  test for him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, well... it wasn't a guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A girl? Typical Collins. He must  have banged her until she couldn't  think straight. Who was it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (barely able to get  it out) It was... Louanne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winters' face goes dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winters, enraged, is venting his spleen at Louanne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, Louanne, how could you be so  stupid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... he was behind, he needed help.  I'm sorry. I just...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry! You're sorry! You've destroyed  my credibility at the University, my  authority with the players... Christ,  it looks like I'm running a dirty  program. And Collins of all people!  What the hell's the matter with you,  Louanne?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (crying) I don't know... I thought he... loved  me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loved you? He loves anything that  winks back, the little rat bastard.  And what are you gonna do for school  now? I use my influence to get you  back in, it'll stink to high hell.  The press'll crucify me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get in someplace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, Louanne, I told you to stay  away from my players. That was my  cardinal rule, stay away from the  damn players...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've always been good enough for  you. Good enough to devote your life  to. Why aren't they good enough for  me? Or are they too good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're changing the subject, Louanne.  We're talkin' about you breakin' the  rules.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't you ever break the rules just  a little? Didn't you tell me once  that 90 per cent of the schools obey  the NCAA rules, and the other 10 per  cent go to bowl games? Was that just  a joke?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gets up and walks out of the room. Winters closes his eyes and slumps down on the couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darnell sits at his table waiting for Autumn. Autumn stor in, obviously upset about something. She slaps a correcte test down in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You seen this? You got a D on your  math test.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeh, I kinda figured that. I had  some trouble on this last part...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We went over that last week, Darnell.  What is this time we spend in here?  Just a joke to you? I don't even  think you've been listening to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been listening to you, baby...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't call me baby. I thought you  wanted to learn. But if all you wanta  do is fake your way through, then  get another tutor to waste time with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Autumn, we just had a good  time, and now you're gettin' all  nuts behind this. It's just one test.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So far, it's the only test. I want  you to study this whole chapter. By  yourself, without me here. When I  come back, we'll discuss it. Be ready  to do problems based on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever you say, Teach. (big grin) I don't wish to be cast in a  pejorative light, so I'm dedicating  myself to achieving on a level more  commensurate with my abilities.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shakes her head and walks away. Darnell's grin fades. looks at his test, a hint of tears in his eyes. He's  embarrassed and deeply worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The players are dressing for Monday practice, but it's  strangely subdued. Bobby Collins opens his locker to find BULLET-RIDDLED PRACTICE JERSEY hanging inside. Immediatel the rest of the players burst into raucous laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coach'd probably shoot ya lower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly the room goes silent. Standing in the doorway is Coach Winters. He says nothing, looks around the room, the players avoid his gaze. His eyes come to rest on Bobby. Bobby tries to  hide the shirt, but Winters has seen. Winters just stares Bobby a beat, then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You all played a fine game on  Saturday. Take the day off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With that, he turns and walks out the door. The players r silent. Bobby throws the shirt in the trash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winters walks in the front door, past the desk, up the st and down the hall to his daughter's room. She's packing h things. He goes over to her, takes her in his arms and hu her tight. Neither speak. A tear rolls down Louanne's che Hits the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A very nervous Bobby Collins comes down the hall and knoc on Coach Winter's door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon in, Collins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby enters and stands across from Winters' desk. Winter doesn't invite him to sit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, Coach, I just want you to  know I'm really sorry about this  whole thing with Louanne. I was real  glad to hear she's gonna be goin' to  junior college here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cutting him off) Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby does. Instantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could easily take your case to the  Board of Regents. You've had no prior  infractions and I could argue that  you were under abnormal pressure. (pause) But I won't. You embarrassed me, you  embarrassed my family, you embarrassed  the program. As of now, you are no  longer a member of this university  or it's football team. Clean out  your locker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby just stands there a beat, in confusion and disbelie There is no wavering, no sympathy in Winters' eyes. Final dazed and disoriented, Bobby turns and walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe is posed in front of the school library, one of it's  more photogenic buildings. T.V. sportscaster LYNN SWANN a his video crew wait to interview him as a MAKEUP GIRL fin applying makeup to Joe's face. Publicist Sharon Braver wa like a hawk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to his cameraman) We ready, Jerry? O.K., let's mark  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An assistant marks the take, and Swann turns to Joe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe, this game is being billed as a  potential "Heisman Shootout". Did  you feel any added pressure this  week...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A phalanx of photographers crowd around, snapping away as Joe goes through passing drills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...knowing that you're going head to  head with Heisman rival, Tim Waymen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, ya know, you try to block it  out, but it's basically impossible...  Everybody seems to be talkin' about  it, all the newspapers, the  interviews...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe is being interviewed by DALLAS PERRY on a local telev show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hype on T.V., tryin' to get  somethin' goin...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sharon Braver steps directly in front of the video camera waves off the take.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold it! Hold it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?! What's the problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Braver takes Joe aside, talks to him confidentially.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you're saying is true, of course,  but I don't think it's the message  you want to send.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe and Camille are sharing a pizza, but not alone. A vid spotlight shines on them, as yet another crew rolls tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It makes you seem a little nervous.  Like the pressure might be getting  to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This game is nationally televised,  so most Heisman voters will be  watching. I think a more casual  approach is better. Modest,  controlled, casual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe nods and heads back in front of the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Braver, irritated) We all set now? (gets a nod) Let's mark it. (the take is marked) Joe, this game is being billed as a  potential "Heisman Shootout."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge bonfire burns, as a large segment of the student b has gathered in front of the Timberwolf statue. The  cheerleaders, all wearing "KANE IS ABLE" buttons, whip th crowd up, as Joe is introduced on the podium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you feel any added pressure this  week, knowing that you're going head  to head with Heisman rival, Tim  Waymen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cheerleaders begin to chant, "Let's go, Joe." On "Joe they assume the Heisman trophy pose. Joe seems slightly  embarrassed by it all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't really think too much  about that kinda thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swann shoots Braver a poisonous look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe and Camille sit on a bank looking down at the railroa tracks below. Neither says anything. Joe seems strangely  preoccupied. Camille decides to break the silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your parents comin' to the game  tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mom's dead. My dad has never seen  me play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess he's not that interested in  football.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you're one of the best players  in the country.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snapping) He's just not into it, o.k.?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chastised) O.k. (silence) What's goin' on, Joe? You ask me out  here, like you wanta talk about  somethin', then you don't say  anything. You worried about tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... I'm worried about the days  after that. I just. I don't know...  I feel like tomorrow's gonna be my  last game. I want to stay up, make  the time go slow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would it be your last game? You  afraid of getting hurt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that'd be a relief. Then, at  least, I wouldn't be a failure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe, why are you thinking like this?  Why would you be a failure? You're  having a great year, you're a Heisman  Trophy candidate, you got millions  of dollars waiting for you in the  pros.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (testy) How do you know what's waiting for  me? You don't know me at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hurt) I don't know you? How can you say  that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you wouldn't be here now if  you did. You only know the guy that's  supposed to make millions in the  pros.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that what you think? That I'm  with you for the money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Infuriated, she slaps him across the face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you, Joe. (starting to cry) I don't give a shit about your money.  I don't even give a shit about  football. And you know what? Maybe  you're right, maybe I don't know  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns and storms away up the hill, as we hear a TRAIN WHISTLE. Joe watches her go, then starts down the hill to the tracks as the train comes into view. Camille stops, turns back, sees Joe headed for the tracks starts to worry. Joe reaches the grade and steps into the middle of the tr facing the oncoming train. Horrified, Camille runs down t embankment toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe! Joe! My god, Joe, what are you  doing? No! No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the train approaches, it's horn blaring, Joe lies face down on the tracks, his hands gripping the railroad ties. Camille arrives at the bottom of the hill in time to see train race over him. She falls to her knees screaming. Under the train, we see Joe desperately hugging the groun head down, toes dug in, hands clutching the ties. It's li a tornado under there, dirt debris flying everywhere, his clothes flapping wildly. The train passes. Camille looks up, afraid to breath as J lies motionless on the tracks. Suddenly he stirs, pushes  himself up to his knees. She lets out a scream of joy, ra toward him, as he gets to his feet, stumbles off the grad She hugs him to her, tears streaming down her face, helps him over to the embankment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God Joe, oh god, are you allright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (drained) Yeh, just got some dirt in my teeth.  Guess you've really seen the dark  side now, huh? You should've gotten  out while you had the chance. Before  it all goes to hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't wanta get out, damnit. What's  wrong Joe? Why would it all go to  hell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a Kane, Camille. That's all it  takes. We're cut out to be drunks  and fuck-ups. We never live up to  expectations. It's in our blood. My  dad, brothers, uncles -- we all drink  and sooner or later we all fuck up.  My dad went the longest. Waited till  he was playin' triple A ball, before  he hit the wall. Sometimes I feel  like I'm just waiting for my turn.  The better I do, the closer it gets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not like them, you can beat  all that. You can stop drinking, you  can break the chain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I gave up that, I wouldn't be  much of a football player. And if I  wasn't a football player, what would  I be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The question hangs in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'de still be Joe. And I'd still  love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls her to him, kisses her hair, they slump against  each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just don't say I never warned you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEVE ZABRISKIE and BO SCHEMBECKLER in the foreground, th jammed to capacity stadium in the background. This shot i going out on nationwide T.V., the college Game of the Wee

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4:29 to go and it's been a great  one. Two undefeated teams goin' after  each other. Michigan up by four, 24- 20, but the lead has changed hands  three times, and you get the feeling  that whoever has the ball last is  gonna win it.

dialogues.speaker: FIELD
dialogues.text: Joe brings the offense to the line of scrimmage. Yells  signals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it was billed as a Heisman  shootout, and it's been all of that.  Both Waymen and Kane moving their  teams up and down the field, having  big days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe fades to pass, looks right, looks left, can't find a  receiver, decides to run for it. He sprints up the middle 15, 10; a SAFETY comes at him at the 5. We see Joe's P.O.V. through HELMETCAM. He pushes the lunging saf away, turns back just in time to be blasted by the OTHER  SAFETY he never saw. Joe is knocked down, over the goal l and out cold. The crowd goes wild.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kane back to pass, can't find anybody,  gonna run it himself, ten, five, hit  at the goal-line... Touchdown E.S.U.!!  Great run by Kane!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe lies motionless as his teamates run over to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's still down. Looks like he's  hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We go to Winters, worried on the sideline, as the celebra around him begins to die down.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: As he's carried off the field, his arms around two lineme shoulders, and lowered onto the bench. We go to a BLURRY  IMAGE of a man's face waving something. We REVERSE to REV a DOCTOR waving smelling salts under Joe's nose. Joe begi to come around. The doctor holds up two fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many fingers am I holding up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michigan comes to the line of scrimmage. As Tim Waymen ge under center, Alvin begins to yell at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, powderpuff. You're the white  boy that ratted my brother out. Sent  him to jail, cocksucker. Ran off  with the fuckin' money. Left the  blood to do the time, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waymen begins to call signals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeh, you're the little bastard.  Account of you, my bros' datin' his  cell mate. You hear me, powderpuff?  Gonna make you pay. You gonna be my  cellmate now. You gonna have 250  lbs. of pissed-off nigger up your  ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: E.S.U. in an eight-man line looking  for the run on third and short.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ball is snapped. Waymen fakes a handoff to his fullba hides the ball on his hip, fades to pass. On the sideline Coach Winters yells, "Pass! Pass!" Alvin's not fooled by the run, he shakes his blocker and  takes dead aim on Waymen. Just as Waymen releases the bal Alvin blasts him, driving him into the turf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waymen fakes to Simms, Mack on the  blitz, Waymen is goin for it all!  Hit as he throws.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ball, however, flies through the air, a perfect spira The E.S.U. secondary has been fooled by the play fake and a step behind. The ball comes down in the hands of the  Michigan tight end, JERRY HUNT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hunt has got a step. He's got it!  Touchdown!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winters slams his headphones to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great clutch throw under pressure.  Can't do it much better than that.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: The Doctor examines Joe, shines a light in his eyes, make him track his finger, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're vision's back to normal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think you can go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeh, I'm fine. Just a little headache. (getting up, shouting  to his teamates) O.K. Offense, let's get it back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alvin, meanwhile, plops down on the bench in disgust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn tough to scare that little white  boy. Either his momma dropped him on  his head, or the motherfucker is  deaf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coach Winters goes to Darnell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jefferson, in for Griffen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Griffen slams his helmet to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe breaks the huddle as the E.S.U. offense comes to the  line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ball on the Michigan 47, 1:02 to go,  Kane brings 'em to the line of  scrimmage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe fades to pass once again, lets the rush come, then fl out a screen pass to Darnell. Darnell grabs it and takes  off, slipping tackles, cutting back, juking. Darnell fina runs out of bounds at the twenty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great run by Jefferson, the highly- touted Freshman, the longest of the  day for the Wolves. And this one is  turning out to be everything we  thought it would be.

dialogues.speaker: DARNELL
dialogues.text: coming back to the huddle, pumped up. Joe kneels in the  center.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O.K., time to put the women and  children to bed, and go looking for  dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He begins to howl, as do all the others. The Call of the  Wild.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 82 Strike, Eagle, Crown, on 2.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They clap hands, come to the line. Joe looks over the def bends under center and barks signals, The ball is snapped Action goes to SLOW MOTION. Joe fakes to Darnell, fades to pass. The Michigan cornerb comes on a blitz, locked on Joe. Joe starts to roll, but  knows the corner will catch him. On the run, he launches ball toward Darnell. Darnell opens his hands to receive i but at the last second, the Michigan SAFETY steps in fron and intercepts it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kane looking for Jefferson. It's...  Intercepted! Intercepted by Freeman!  And that should do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe sinks to his knees in frustration. The blitzing corne does a quick pit-pat on Joe's helmet. Winters looks like  he's been punched. As Michigan and Tim Waymen celebrate on the sideline, we to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve Zabriskie is doing the wrap-up, the emptying stadiu behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it was everything we expected  it to be. Fine performances on both  sides of the field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Players undress and shower in relative silence. No joy he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The edge in the much ballyhooed battle  of the quarterbacks would probably  have to go to Michigan's Tim Waymen  who threw for 2 touchdowns, and ran  for another. Joe Kane accounted for  three E.S.U. touchdowns, but had  that crucial interception in the  waning moments. And that proved to  be the difference.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door of the locker room opens, and a flood of reporte enter. Joe hides back in the showers, leaning his forehea against the wall, the water coursing over him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darnell comes out of the locker room, having showered and dressed. He's surprised to see Autumn and her father talk to Coach Humes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Autumn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Darnell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this your dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you do, Mr. Haley. I'm Darnell  Jefferson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jefferson? Nice run you made on that  screen pass. Another block and you  might have scored.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. We'll get 'em next year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you and Autumn know each other?  You a friend of Ray's?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darnell is jolted by this question. It's obvious that Aut has never told her dad about him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filling the void) Ah, I tutor him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh really? In what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darnell would like to crawl under a rock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Math and English.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a slight tone of condescension in Mr. Haley's voi He realizes Darnell hasn't passed his entrance exam. This not lost on Darnell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, stay on top of that, Darnell.  I'd have been in real trouble if I  hadn't gotten my degree. I played  ball once. Hurt my knee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeh, I know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I used to put a copy of my report  card inside the webbing of my helmet  to remind me that college was more  important than football.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (forcing enthusiasm) Good idea. Well, I gotta get goin'.  Nice to meet you Mr. Haley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you, Darnell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you around, Autumn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before Autumn can respond, Ray Griffen approaches from th other direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Mr. Haley. Good to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Ray. You still havin' dinner  with us tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darnell embarrassed and humiliated, hears all this as he  walks away. Autumn wants to go explain, but can't in fron of her father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The post-game party. Not as raucous as after the opening  game victory. A few players are dancing, but most are sit drinking, commiserating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Alvin) Anybody seen Joe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet. Probably out with Camille.  Haven't seen Darnell either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lattimer's sitting on the bed with a coed named LESLIE.  They're kissing softly, light necking. Lattimer starts to unbutton her blouse. She begins to demur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we better get back downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Leslie, we're just getting to  know each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (starting to get up) No, I think...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lattimer grabs her arm roughly, pulls her back to the bed She's starting to get a little scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon Leslie, you didn't come up  here to stop now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tries to kiss her again, she pushes him away, starts f the door. Angered, that steroid pump in his eyes, he grab her again, throws her violently on the bed. She screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What were you doin'? Leadin' me on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets on the bed, kneels above her. She starts to strug He slaps her across the face, rips her blouse open. Freak she begins to scream and kick. Enraged, Lattimer slaps he around, picks her up, shakes her like a rag doll, slaps h some more, throws her to the floor. Picks her up again, w suddenly the door BURSTS OPEN and Bud Lite and Alvin race in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (throwing Leslie on  the bed again) Get outa here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud Lite and Alvin charge Lattimer, try to wrestle him do but his hormone level is so high, he fights like a bull. other players charge in and finally all four are able to  shackle Lattimer. He continues to struggle a bit, then gi up, a panting, sweating, shaking hulk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is it, man. No more 'roids.  This shit has gotta stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lattimer breaks down and cries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe lies on his bed, a bottle of vodka next to his coca-c He stares at the larger than life cardboard stand-up of  himself. He takes a drink, then gets up and grabs his jac The phone rings. He looks at it a beat, then walks out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camille's on the phone, waiting, the one calling Joe. She listens a few more rings, hangs up, concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winters sits at the main console replaying the game-endin interception over and over. The phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, yeh... What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rest of the locker room is dark except for the light in Winters' office. All the assistant coaches are there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looks like this will blow over.  The girl's father is a big booster,  contributed a lotta money. So he  said they won't go to the press.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said that? The father?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeh, he's not exactly happy about  all this, but he doesn't wanta hurt  the program.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're still gonna have to suspend  Lattimer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What for? There aren't any charges.  Nobody outside the program knows  about this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's outa control, Lyle. We can't  ignore this anymore. I don't know  what pisses me off more -- that he's  juicin' or that he's doin' such a  shitty job of hidin' it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's never tested positive. If we  suspend him without proof, he could  sue us for jeopardizing his draft  status, his pro career.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeh, but we can't sit and wait till  he kills somebody. I hate to lose  him as much as you do, but we gotta  clean him up before he does somethin'  that lands the whole program on  probation. Plus, we have to take  some action or the girl's dad is  gonna start havin' second thoughts.  I don't care how many checks he's  written.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what do we do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All eyes go to Winters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring him down here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close on a contrite, but shaken Steve Lattimer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three games? Why so many?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You oughta be grateful I didn't  suspend you for the whole year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lattimer nods, he knows it's true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you gonna give as the reason?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll say you've got a hamstring  pull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (relieved) Thank you, Coach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't thank me. During those three  weeks, you better kick the roids,  cause when you come back I'm gonna  personally test you before every  game. No N.C.A.A. shit either. I'm  gonna watch the piss go into the  bottle. You got that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (barely audible, shamed) Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Start practicing your limp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not the 911 we saw earlier. Joe sits at a table in the ba with Darnell, drinking tequila with a beer chaser. Both a down in the dumps. At a nearby table there's a group of  TOWNIES and their GIRLFRIENDS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coupla real college heroes, huh?  Tearin' up the town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First time I ever lost a girl and a  game on the same day. Guess I never  really had the girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe looks up to see one of the townies' girls, DEBBIE, gi him the once over and a little smile. Joe smiles back, no really interested. Debbie's BOYFRIEND notices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know that guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not really...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why you smilin' at him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know... he looks like that  E.S.U. quarterback guy. Joe, what's  his name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what? So you go and smile at him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boyfriend, drunk and looking for trouble, goes over t Joe's table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You been lookin' at my girlfriend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a little drunk himself) I don't know. Which one is she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wise guy, huh? Mr. bigtime  quarterback. The one who choked his  ass off today. You got nothin' better  to do then look at my girlfriend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Heisman, I'm talkin' to you.  You too good to talk to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not even interested in talkin'  to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think you're a bad ass? You think  my girl's hot for you? Take your  pads off, you're just another pussy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe gets up to go. The boyfriend grabs him, Joe pushes hi away. The guy charges Joe. The bar owner rushes to the ph as a full scale brawl begins. Joe takes a blow, knocks th boyfriend back into a table, knocking beer bottles to the floor. The boyfriend falls on one, opening a deep gash in his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabbing him) C'mon we gotta get outa here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A speeding car goes by us, weaving, crossing the yellow l on the curves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe's driving, Darnell's holding on. Suddenly we hear SIR Joe sees flashing lights in the rear-view mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winters is asleep. The phone rings. He picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it now?... Oh Jesus...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe sits across the desk from Winters, just the two of th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy went for me first. What was  I supposed to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't make any difference. It made  the papers, all the wire services.  The guy had to go to the hospital.  Worst of all they got you on drunk  driving. You had a blood alcohol  level .50 above the legal limit. We  can't smooth that over, Joe. It'd  look like we were sprayin' Pledge on  bird shit. We had to agree to send  you to Rehab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rehab? I'll be a god-damn joke. You  can't do this to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was the only way we could get  them to drop the assault and D.W.I.  You go to trial on those, we lose  you for a year, and risk NCAA  investigation. C'mon, lotsa athletes  have been through Rehab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not in the middle of the season. Not  in the middle of a Heisman campaign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll only miss four games. You'll  be back in time for the last one,  Georgia Tech, and a Bowl if we get  there. Plus, you've still got your  senior year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeh, but what will I come back as?  What kinda player?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, you'll still be the  Man. You'll still be the leader of  this team.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe doesn't believe it, but he manages a nod, as he gets to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Coach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These things happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe walks on out, Winters watches him go, then slams the  desk in anger. Drained, he sinks back in his chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuckin' kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darnell's walking across campus toward class. Autumn sees him, calls out to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darnell, wait. C'mon Darnell, I wanta  talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darnell doesn't slow up. Autumn has to run to catch up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you been, I been callin' you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Been busy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darnell, I'm sorry about Saturday.  It was an awkward situation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't awkward. It was educational.  I realized how you see me. I'm good  enough to tutor, to go places with,  but not to tell your father about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not it. It's just that my  father expects me to be with somebody  like Ray. He wouldn't understand us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stopping) Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know... he likes Ray cause...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a good student, he acts right...  he doesn't need football. He's class  and I'm not, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't say that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to, Autumn. I'm  everything your dad used to be and  don't want you fallin' back into.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darnell...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were right before, Autumn. I  should have another tutor. Thanks  for everything you did for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darnell walks away. Autumn can only watch him go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe finishes packing his bags. He sees a picture of Camil on the dresser. Picks it up, looks at it a beat, drops it the trash. He carries his Heisman cardboard standup into shower, pulls out a match and lights it. He watches it ca fire, then grabs his suitcase and walks out of the room. hold on the burning standup, as flames lick at Joe's smil

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe is shown into his room. Bare. One cot. One dresser. H drops his bag, sags onto the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four fuckin' weeks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tired and depressed group of E.S.U. football players un after practice. Bud and Alvin sit in their pads, Lattimer standing in street clothes. Bud softly sings "Don't Cry F Me Argentina."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, the defense is gonna have to  pitch shutouts now... (to Lattimer) and you're gone for 3. What the hell  did you take that shit for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody seemed to mind when I was  knockin' people's dicks in the dirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bust chops too. I don't have to  get all fucked up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not everybody has the ability you  do, Alvin. You do what you have to  do to play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you're not playin' much now  are you? Shit, whole fuckin' season  down the drain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winters and Galen Howard are walking across the field aft practice. The stadium is deserted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I been talkin' to Chancellor Wilson...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's he wanta do now, cut practice  down to once a week?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, he's happy with the way the  season's gone so far. The Alumni  have pretty much stayed off his back,  but with Joe out now, it could all  be up for grabs again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He thinks he's gonna have trouble  marchin' the ball down the old fund- raisin' board, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The facts are, all we have left are  freshman quarterbacks, and nothin' I  saw at practice today, convinced me  that any of them are ready to step  in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you sayin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta get Bobby Collins back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wilson say that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't have to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it, Galen, Collins is no All- Star either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeh, but he's good enough to get us  a split of the next four games.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, just because you're Wilson's  boy all of a sudden, doesn't mean  I'm gonna let him make me look like  a fuckin' whore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't give me that high and mighty  shit. There's a lotta people on the  bubble here. Four straight loses and  we're out of bowl contention. How's  that gonna make you look? If you're  too stupid to consider your own  situation, then maybe you oughta  think about your assistant coaches.  They've got families to feed too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howard walks away, pissed off, leaving Winters alone in t middle of the field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The seven members of the BOARD OF REGENTS sit on one side a long rectangular table, the Chairman in the middle. On other side are coach Winters, Bobby Collins, the Presiden of the Faculty Senate, EDWARD LEARNIHAN, Academic Advisor ARTHUR SHANE, President of the Student Body, RICHARD FOWL and Galen Howard. Fowler is addressing the board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Therefore, I respectfully submit  that Bobby Collins should not be  given special treatment just because  he's a football player. Would a  regular student get a reinstatement  hearing if they'de been caught  cheating? Nobody's talking about  letting the girl who took the test  back in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winters could kill this kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's also instructive to  look at some of the courses this  young man has taken. Beginning Golf,  Voice and Speech Improvement...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to point out that Mr. Collins  was still on schedule to get his  degree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing to Collin's  transcript) In what, Swimming Pool Management?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like to respond, Coach  Winters?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winters rises, sweating, less from nervousness than from odious nature of what he has to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know much about all this  other stuff, but I do know the  punishment should fit the crime.  Cheating's bad, but I don't think it  deserves a life sentence. Here's one  of those athletes who takes college  level courses, who wants to graduate.  I think Bobby Collins made a big  mistake, but he's already been  suspended for several weeks. He's  served his time. I think he deserves  a second chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like Alvin Mack? We gave him a second  chance and since he's had 5  incompletes, 4 withdrawals and still  reads at a fourth grade level. You're  using his body to make money for the  Athletic Department -- you, yourself,  are making three times what the  Chancellor is -- but obviously no  one is making an effort to see that  this kid gets an education.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's helpin' to pay for your physics  lab too. If you're willin' to go  without a new office, maybe I could  hold him out a few games. Save his  body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alvin was way behind in school when  he got here. You can't make up for,  in four years, what it took 18 to  create.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he should never have been  admitted in the first place. It's  not fair to other students who worked  hard to get here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it fair to exclude kids who come  from inferior schools? You hold  everybody to the same standards,  you're discriminating against the  poor kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most of my players are farm boys,  inner-city kids. Football is their  deliverance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deliverance from what? A valid  education?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You throw Bobby Collins and Alvin  out, you take away their futures. In  Alvin's case you probably cost him a  couple million dollars in the pros.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But this is not a football vocational  school. It's an Institute of Higher  Learning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeh, but when was the last time 80,000  people showed up to watch a kid do a  chemistry experiment?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, please, let's get back to  the business at hand, Bobby Collins.  As you know, I played football here.  And I remember how hard it was to  practice and then study when you're  dead tired. So I have some sympathy  for this young man. But I never  cheated, so the real question is his  character. Since you know him better  than anyone else in this room; and  having talked to him and observed  him over the last several weeks, do  you feel he's learned his lesson? In  other words, can you vouch for his  character?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winters would rather cut off his own head with a razor bl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (it's killing him) Yes, sir, I can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby Collins breaks into a wide, triumphant smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Learnihan and Winters come down the steps, their faces se As they split off:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another case like this, I'll take it  all the way up to the Governor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't mess with me, Learnihan. I'll  have you teachin' Study Hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby Collins walks in prior to practice. His teammates g round, slap him on the back, high five etc. Winters watch from his office, disgusted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coach Winters is in his video alcove watching footage of upcoming opponent -- it's like he's looking through it th his mind elsewhere, something boiling up inside him. Sudd he smashes his fist into the screen, breaking it into pie His hand bleeds. He doesn't care. He just sits there and  seethes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camille's on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, my name is Camille Schaeffer.  I'd like to speak to Joe Kane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe is aimlessly flipping cards toward a wastebasket. A N knocks on his door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got a phone call. A Camille  Schaeffer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe says nothing, not wanting to deal with this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She says she's your girlfriend

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to talk to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The nurse leaves. Joe gets up, goes to the wall, and star pounding it with his right hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, he doesn't wish to speak  to you right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crushed and angry, Camille hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud Lite is watching television. Louanne enters on her wa to Bobby Collins' room, carrying an armload of neatly-pre laundry. But Lite gets up to bar her way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Louanne, how ya' doin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine, Bud, ya know. Goin to J.C.,  hopin' to get back in here next year.  Just came by to give Bobby some  laundry I did for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You two seein' each other again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeh, he was even talking about us  gettin' a place off campus together,  until he got reinstated. I don't  know how I woulda told my dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud just nods blankly. Louanne starts to head for Bobby's room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, Louanne... (pained to say it) I wouldn't go in there right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud doesn't have the heart to tell her. She finally reali Bobby's with another girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah. Guess I'm pretty stupid when it  comes to men. I never learn, do I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think maybe men are just stupid  when it comes to you. If you ever  feel like, ya know, just talkin'  sometime, gettin' a beer -- let me  know. My schedule's pretty open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Bud (handing him the  clothes) Give him these, will ya?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud nods. Louanne, fighting back tears, walks back down t hall with as much dignity as she can muster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winters comes to the door, hesitates, walks in and finds huddled on his bed. Shivering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get up. I wanta talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe looks resentful but makes an effort and sits up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't sit up. Stand up. If you can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe gets unsteadily to his feet. He feels sick. Winters  reaches out to shake hands. Joe does not reciprocate. Hid his right hand behind his body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter, Joe? You won't  shake hands with me. (Joe is silent) You don't want me to see your hand,  do you? (more silence) So I guess what I heard was true,  huh? You been poundin' the walls  with your passin' hand, right? (silence) I tell you what, Joe, you want to  hit somethin', hit me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe doesn't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said hit me. I'm the one who put  you in here. Don't hit the damn wall.  It ain't the wall's fault. Hit me!  Go on, hit me right now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe is angry but he doesn't want to do anything about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who else you wanta hit, huh? you're  daddy maybe? Cause he's a no-show  prick? Well, I'm a daddy, too, and  not a very good one at that. So just  hit me instead! I'll take your daddy's  beatin' for him. Go on, you want to.  Hit me, damnit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pushes Joe in the  chest) Hit me! I'm not gonna leave you alone  until you hit me. (shakes Joe by  shoulders) The guys'll thank you. They've always  wanted to do it. So do it now, damnit!  Do it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe sinks to his knees. Winters stares down at him, then  kneels also, his own anger and frustration draining away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O.K., Joe, it's o.k. I guess I need  it more than you do. (pause) You gotta quit beatin' up on yourself.  Let me see that hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe reveals his hand. It's barked and cut, but not badly  swollen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's o.k. (playfully) You can still throw with it, you  fuckin' mook. (pause) Look, the nurses say this is the  toughest time for you right now. I  thought I'd stick around a little,  case you wanta play some cards, pick  a fight with the wall again,  whatever...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lattimer fills a bag with all his steroid paraphernalia. carries it to his bathroom where he slowly empties it int his toilet. Syringes, vials and bottles of pills all tumb into the water. He flushes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun shines through the window. Joe wakes up, raises u looks over at Winters who is asleep in a chair. Winters  rouses. Joe gives him a little smile, he's allright. Wint gives him a nod of approval.

dialogues.speaker: MUSIC UP. BEGIN A SERIES OF SHOTS
dialogues.text: detailing the Timberwolves progress over the next four ga

dialogues.speaker: ON FIELD
dialogues.text: 1) Players shaking hands at midfield after the game. The  scoreboard reads E.S.U. 14 Boston College 10.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 2) Darnell in study hall, with his new tutor concentratin on her explanation, applying himself.

dialogues.speaker: ON SIDELINE
dialogues.text: 3) Steve Lattimer, in street clothes, paces the sidelines jumping up and down in frustration, his hamstring bandage to sell the injury ruse. He catches himself, gets back on his crutches. A newspaper fades up through the shot. It r "Wolves Offense Fires Blanks in 13-0 Loss to Texas."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4) Darnell sits in a cafe, drinking coffee and studying. comes in, his arm around a co-ed, MONICA. They buy a past and leave, not having seen Darnell. Darnell ponders this second, goes back to studying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 5) A group of patients is gathered around a T.V. set in t Rehab Center, watching a pre-game show. One goes to Joe's room, where Joe's lying on his cot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Joe, don't you wanta watch the  game? It's on cable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe leans back, staring at the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: ON T.V. SCREEN
dialogues.text: 6) Sportscaster DALLAS PERRY is holding forth on the loca evening news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: E.S.U. on the strength of a 62 yard  touchdown run by freshman Darnell  Jefferson, squeaked by the North  Carolina Tarheels today, 14 to 13,  keeping their bowl hopes alive.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. CAMPUS NIGHT
dialogues.text: 7) Darnell, with his books, on the way to the library, pa the frat house where the victory party is in progress. He sees Ray and Autumn walking together. Autumn sees him, he face lights up. He gives her a slight smile, keeps walkin She watches him with a certain longing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 8) Darnell, alone in the library, late at night, studying

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 9) Lattimer, carrying his gear bag, walks into the locker room. His teammates come over to shake his hand, slap him the back, welcome him back to the team.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe sits on his bed listening to the E.S.U. broadcast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: E.S.U. hoping to get past a tough  Iowa Hawkeyes team in their last  game before the return of star  quarterback, Joe Kane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The E.S.U. defense is on the field. Alvin moves up opposi the OFFENSIVE GUARD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you, motherfucker. You're the  prick who got my little sister  pregnant. We ain't seen you around  lately. Where you been, huh? Answer  me, motherfucker, or I'm gonna peel  your cap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ball is hiked. Iowa runs a sweep left. Lattimer tries get outside to contain, but is blocked by the fullback, w goes low and cuts his legs out from under him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, Lattimer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alvin pursues the play as the ballcarrier heads for the  corner, then suddenly cuts back. Alvin has overrun the pl slightly. We go to SLOW MOTION as he turns and is hit wit wicked CRACK-BACK BLOCK by the guard he taunted. Alvin's flexes at a horrifying angle. We HEAR THE SNAP of bone an tendon, as Alvin plummets to the ground, writhing in pain grabbing his left leg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doctor and trainers sprint out to the field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We move in on Joe's face, as Harvey is heard on the radio the b.g.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, boy, this does not look good,  Harmon. They're bringing the  stretchers out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe's eyes close. He knows what this means.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alvin is being strapped on the stretcher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wailing in pain) Oh, shit, oh shit, I'll kill that  motherfucker. I'll... Oh shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ambulance carrying Alvin emerges from the stadium. We  hear CHEERING inside, the SIREN outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twelve seconds left, Iowa driving  for the winning touchdown. Fourth  and goal at the one. E.S.U. trying  to hold on without their star middle  linebacker, Alvin Mack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The E.S.U. defensive line digs in. Lattimer tries to suck his remaining strength. Iowa runs a blast to Lattimer's side. He fights through o block, the ballcarrier coming right toward him. They meet a titanic collision at the goal line. The back keeps driv twisting. Lattimer tries to hold him, but weaker than he on steroids, is unable to. The back falls over the goal l Touchdown. IOWA 13 E.S.U. 10. As the Iowa players celebrate all around him, Lattimer si where he fell, a beaten and humiliated young man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coach, you've lost two of your last  four.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coach Winters faces the press.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do your teams seem to nose dive  at the end of the last couple seasons?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This was a tough loss, but this ain't  any nose dive. We've had some key  players out, but if we win next week,  we'll still win the conference and  go to a major bowl on New Year's  Day. I mean, I know you guys can't  write, but I thought you could at  least count.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alvin lies on a bed, his leg bandaged and elevated. He's  still a little groggy from anesthetic. Coach Winters stan beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look good, Alvin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeh, I feel o.k.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any of the guys been down yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They called.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell, you know how football players  are about hospitals and injuries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several beats of silence. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm never gonna play again, am I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctors aren't always right, Alvin...  but I just want you to know... you're  the best defensive football player I  ever coached.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alvin nods. Winters comes forward, hugs him around the he gives him a smile, walks out. Tears brim in Winters eyes he leaves. Alvin's head goes back against the pillow. Tea aren't brimming here. They're rolling down his cheeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe walks out with his suitcase. Coach Winters waits for  him. Shakes his hand. They get in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations. I'm proud of you,  Joe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you had a difficult time.  Michigan is easy, right? Bourbon is  tough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They share a laugh. Winters pulls out two sets of round t airline tickets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got somethin' for ya. Coupla round  trip tickets. Go see your dad. Get  it cleaned up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe takes the tickets, just looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the phone) I'm gonna have to take a test with  the coach right there. You sure you  got somethin' better than blockers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Much better. This guy is foolproof.  See ya Saturday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lattimer hangs up, picks up a HYPODERMIC. Stares at it a  second, sweat beading on his forehead. Then plunges it an inch deep into his thigh. Pulls it out, sits on the bed a beat, then picks up a barbell and begins to pump it furio biceps bulging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The coach is facing Ray and Darnell across his desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanta do something different for  this game. Try to maximize our speed,  but keep you both in the lineup at  the same time. Ray, I'm moving you  to fullback. Darnell, you're startin'  at tail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray is stunned, Darnell elated, but neither says a word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray, you'll be carrying the ball  less and blocking more, but they'll  still have to respect your running  and pass-catching ability. Not  everybody can make a transition like  this. You think you can handle it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tight lipped) Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. We can't afford any hang dogs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camille comes off the court, after tennis practice. She's surprised to find Joe waiting for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Camille.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cool) Hello, Joe. You allright now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeh... yeh, I think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good, I'm happy for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts to walk away, heading for the bike racks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camille, hold on, O.K.? I'm sorry  that I didn't want... that I couldn't  see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You couldn't even talk to me. What  happened to "there's somethin' goin'  on between you and me"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camille gets on her bike...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Camille, I was embarrassed. I  couldn't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and pedals off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting after her) I couldn't understand why anybody  would wanta talk to me. Camille!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She just keeps on going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bus comes up the hill toward us, on the main street of  Joe's sooty, little home town, the huge stacks of moribun steel works filling the sky in the background. The bus st at a corner. Joe steps off. No bag. He's not planning on  staying long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe goes to the front door. Knocks, gets no answer, pushe the door open, walks through the messy, cluttered house t the back porch. Seated in a metal folding chair, smoking cigarette, looking out at the yard is Joe's DAD. He's got couple days growth of beard, and although not drunk now, has the look of one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How ya doin', Dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised to see him) Joe! What's this? They throw you  out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard about your little set-to.  They had it on the news here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeh, they sent me to rehab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We know what that's worth. Your  brother's been through it three times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe nods sadly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what are you doin' here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been thinking about some things,  Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what that damn rehab'll do.  Make you think about a lotta things  you can't do nothing' about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I kinda been wonderin' why you never  came to any of my games. All those  years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I don't know. I guess I didn't  wanta make you nervous. You mighta  tried too hard and screwed up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or I mighta done real well. Which  woulda been harder on you, Dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sensing the anger) What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mighta made you feel bad. Like maybe  it wasn't written someplace that we  all gotta go on our ass. Like maybe  you coulda done somethin' more, if  you'de tried a little harder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or maybe I didn't wanta see you  gettin' all excited, all pumped up  with pride, when I knew one day it  would all come crashin' down. Just  like it did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I spent the last couple years  hopin' I'd die before that day. But  you know what Dad? That day came and  I'm still here. And I got one more  game this year. I don't know how  well I'll play or even how much, but  I want you there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How would you feel introducing your  drunk dad to all your friends? You  think about that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could live with it, if you could. (handing him a ticket) Here's a ticket. Section 2, Row 6.  Fifty yard line. If you don't come,  I'll never ask you again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O.K., Joey. And good luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They give each other a short, quick hug. Nothing sentimen Joe walks back through the house. His dad stares out at t yard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darnell is up late again, studying at one of the tables. hears footsteps, becomes aware of the presence of another person. He looks up to see Autumn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Autumn. How's Ray?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't know. Haven't seen him since  the night I saw you. He'd been goin'  out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monica Lambert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You knew? Why didn't you tell me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't wanta win you over that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. Darnell looks back at his books.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wondered how your studying  was comin'. You ready for tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
