dialogues.text: The test? I hope so. I been workin'  pretty hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good... (sitting down) I talked to my dad last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah? How's he doin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. We talked about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eyes brimming) I told him I'd gone out with you...  I told him I wished I could still go  bowling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darnell gets up and pulls her to her feet. He hugs her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darnell is bent over his test booklet. He writes furiousl stops to think, starts writing again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe takes a snap, fades to pass, throws an out. The ball  flutters badly, falling short.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's rusty. I doubt if we can start  him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (simmering) He's worse than that. He's outa shape. (blowing his whistle) All right, that's enough for today.  Practice is cancelled. Everybody off  the field, but Kane. (the players hesitate) C'mon what the hell are you standin'  around lookin' at? Get outa here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The players, surprised at this turn of events, begin to f off. Even the coaches are baffled. Winters walks over to  Joe, who has no idea what this is about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't do much while you were in  there, did ya?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we didn't exactly have a team...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could've worked out on your own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had some other things to worry  about...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we're gonna make up for lost  time. We'll start by hoppin' the  steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hoppin' the steps?! What, you're  gonna punish me now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't talk back to me, Joe. I'll  kick your ass. I went easy on you,  'cause you had to get through detox,  but that's out to sea now. You let  this team down; you let this program  down. Start those steps. Right leg.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: Hopping up the stadium steps on his right foot, laboring he passes Winters, halfway up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now the left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe switches to his left foot and continues hopping up th steps, his quadriceps bursting with pain.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: hanging by his arms, moving hand over hand along the cros of the goalpost, panting with fatigue, Winters watching f below.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: Bone weary now. Winters has him run 20 yards, get down an do 10 pushups, run another 20 yards, do 10 more pushups e Joe staggers the 20 yards, drops to do his pushups, can o do 4. Winters yanks him to his feet, pushes him forward t run again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 70 guys. 70 guys who busted their  butts all year. Because of you they  might not win the conference. Because  of you they might not go to a bowl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (barely able to stand) I didn't wanna leave... I just screwed  up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You dogged on them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stopping, exhausted) No, no I never dogged. I worked my  ass off. I played hard...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pushing him forward) Then you shoulda stayed in shape.  Keep runnin', dammit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wobbling, starting  to break down) I always played hard. I gave my  everything for you. When you came to  the Center, I thought you were really  worried about me. But you don't give  a shit. We're all just a buncha sled  dogs. If you had another guy who  could throw, you'da left me in the  fuckin' hospital. (falling to his knees,  sobbing) The only thing that matters is the  program, the god-damn program.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winters pushes Joe down to do his pushups. Joe has to str mightily to do two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody forced you to play football,  Joe. Not me, not the program, nobody.  But when you sign on, you commit  yourself to pay the price, to do  whatever it takes. Well, you haven't  paid the price yet. You still owe  this team. You owe this team big- time. (walking away) Get a shower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe tries to get up, but collapses face down on the turf, Winters continues to walk away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lattimer lies on a table, a CATHETER TUBE going into his  side. A DOCTOR'S AIDE supervises. Lattimer's dealer is th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this doin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Takin' doped urine outa your bladder  and puttin clean back in. Call it an  oil change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coach Winters watches unknowingly as Lattimer pees the  catheterized urine into a cup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The team is gathered around. Conspicuous among them is  Lattimer, who's painted his face like a skeleton. Coach  Winters is whipping them up with a pre-game rant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotta get it done today, boys. Gotta  ring that bell. 60 minutes. 60 minutes  of mean. No prisoners. No mercy.  Nothin' but snot bubbles. Gotta ring  that bell, gotta ring that  Championship bell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting) Ding Motherfucking Dong!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pumped to the gills, the E.S.U. team explodes in yells an races out into the tunnel. The YELLING continues OVER and mixes with the CHEERING OF THE CROWD as:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wolves movin' left to right on your  radio dial. Looking to generate some  offense. They've been up and down  the last few weeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON BOBBY COLLINS in the huddle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 28 Thunder right. On go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They break and the E.S.U. offense comes to the line. Coll calls signals. We go to SLOW MOTION as he fades to pass.  Darnell fakes a block, then rolls out for a screen pass.  Georgia Tech's defensive line comes hard. Bobby flips the ball over the charging defenders. Darnell catches it, get good block from Bud Lite, then tucks in behind Ray who is out ahead blocking. There's only one linebacker to beat and Darnell will be i the secondary. Figuring Ray will block the guy, Darnell b to look for the safeties. Ray, however, barely brushes th linebacker, who doesn't even break stride. He lowers his  head, and drives into Darnell, his helmet hitting the  football. Fumble! There's a scramble. The Yellow Jackets  free safety comes up with it.

dialogues.speaker: REGULAR SPEED
dialogues.text: The crowd and the E.S.U. bench, quickly deflated, sit bac down. Darnell gets to his feet, glares at Ray, but says  nothing. He knows Ray tanked the block.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alvin sits alone in the "living room", listening to the E game on the radio, his leg propped up on an apple crate. mother mends a pair of jeans in the b.g.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So the Wolves defense has held after  the fumble, and the Yellow Jackets  will opt for the field goal. Around  a 34 yarder. Ball is down, it's away,  it's long enough. And good! Georgia  Tech jumps out on top 3-0.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alvin's mother looks to see if there's any reaction from  Alvin. There's none.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby Collins fades back to pass, is rushed, throws a qui sideline, but it's a little short. The Yellow Jackets'  CORNERBACK sprints up, intercepts it and runs 30 yards do the sideline for a touchdown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collins back to pass, rushed, now  fires out in the flat. It's picked  off by Hill. Down the sideline. He's  gonna go in untouched. Touchdown,  Georgia Tech.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A discouraged bunch of E.S.U. players drag into the locke room. Some swear, some bang their lockers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon guys, we're only down ten.  Let's get our fuckin' shit together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darnell marches over to Ray's locker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You missed that block on purpose,  didn't you, asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're full of shit. You fumble, you  try to blame me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Autumn isn't it? That's what  this is all about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hell with Autumn. You just can't  take a hit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Infuriated, Darnell goes for Ray, and they start swinging Darnell tackles Ray, they roll on the floor, still swingi trying to beat the shit out of each other. Finally, sever players manage to pull them apart. Coach Winters charges  over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell me who started it. I don't  care. All I care about is this  football team. We win together. We  lose together. So whatever your  problem is, get over it. I don't  want any more of this shit.  Understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As for the rest of you guys. Here's  what I think of the way you played.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winters walks over to a table set up with 75 cups of Oran Juice and Gatorade. He swipes the cups off the table crea a small flood on the floor. Then turns the table over. Th players are shocked. They've seldom seen him like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing toward the  Yellow Jackets' locker  room) They're laughin' at you over there.  Makin' plans for the evening. They  never dreamed it'd be this easy. You  guys are nothin' but bugs splattered  on their windshield. You better stock  up on potato chips, 'cause you're  gonna be watching a lotta T.V. on  New Years Day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winters walks away, as the players are left to contemplat their mistakes. Winters goes over to Joe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get warm, Joe. You're startin' the  second half.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe nods, excited but uncertain. Winters moves on to Ray  Griffen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the way... don't let me see you  miss anymore blocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The E.S.U. players return to their bench for the start of the second half, gather in a circle. Joe looks up in the  stands to the seat he reserved for his father. It's empty

dialogues.speaker: BEGIN A SERIES OF SHOTS
dialogues.text: 1) Joe takes the snap from center, fumbles it, falls on i 2) Joe looks to throw over the middle, waits too long, is sacked. 3) Joe underthrows Darnell coming out of the backfield.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clayton approaches Winters on the sideline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe's too tentative, too cautious  out there. He seems flat. Maybe we  oughta give Collins another shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe just needs to get the feel back.  He'll be allright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, we can't afford to wait...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snapping) I said he'll be allright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 5:51 to go. Georgia Tech up 10 to  nothing. The Wolves are gonna have  to find some offense in a hurry here.  Their defense has been keepin' them  in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he starts off the bench for the field, Coach Winters c up to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe, I know that Rehab was good for  you. Got rid of a lotta bad habits.  But what about the rest of you? What  happened to the Joe Kane that used  to take command of this team, the  Joe Kane these guys i'd run through  a bulldozer for? They put him out  with the trash? What are you waitin'  for, somebody to feel sorry for you  cause you've had some problems? Nobody  in this stadium gives a shit. It's  time to step up, Joe. Time to sit at  the head of the Table.

dialogues.speaker: THE E.S.U. OFFENSIVE HUDDLE
dialogues.text: As Joe comes into the huddle. He's all business now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, we've held these guys up  long enough. Give me time back here,  and I'll rip 'em apart. 16 shift,  green, bolt. First sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe brings the offense to the line of scrimmage, yells "G The ball is snapped, Joe drops back, hits Darnell on the  sideline. First down. In quick succession, we see Joe: 1) Complete a 15 yarder to Ray over the middle. 2) Fades to pass, is rushed. Forced out of the pocket,  scrambles for his life, manages to get down to the 4 yard line. He gets up, surveys the distance to pay dirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice bit of scrambling by Kane to  get it to the four, but it's gonna  bring up fourth and goal. No doubt  about it, with 3:45 they've gotta go  for it here, if they're gonna get  back in this game.

dialogues.speaker: THE SIDELINE
dialogues.text: Winters puts his arm around Ray who will take the play in the huddle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give it to me up the gut, Coach.  They've been ignoring me. I know I  can score.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, we're gonna go with the sweep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winters gives Ray a shove and he runs onto the field. Ray upset, angry. He swears to himself.

dialogues.speaker: FIELD
dialogues.text: Ray enters the huddle, whispers in Joe's ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 28 Thunder right. On 2.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The team breaks out, comes to the line. Joe looks over th defense, screams signals as the CROWD NOISE is building. We go to SLOW MOTION as the ball is snapped. Ray takes on step forward then turns right, leading the play. Joe pitc to Darnell who follows Ray. Georgia Tech's outside lineba comes up to stop the play. Ray stumbles before he can mak the block. He drops out of our picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darnell is forced to go wider toward the sideline. The  linebacker and cornerback are closing, both have the angl on him. Darnell starts to cut back. He lowers his shoulde to take the linebacker's blow. Suddenly, out of nowhere, reappears and throws a devastating block on the linebacke knocking him back into the cornerback, taking them both o Darnell cuts it up and blasts over the safety at the goal line. Touchdown, E.S.U. The stands erupt. It's the first thing they've had to che about all day. Winters just looks at the clock, goes over talk to his defense. Darnell foregoes his touchdown dance. He runs over to Ray grabs him by the helmet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monster block, man. Monster  motherfuckin' block.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray smiles. They butt heads and run off the field

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly to himself) All right, defense. Let's get evil.  Kill 'em all, let the paramedics  sort 'em out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Georgia Tech has the ball. They break their huddle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1:11 and counting. Third and one.  The Wolves have got to stop them on  this play if they're gonna get the  ball back. A first down here and  it's all she wrote. E.S.U. is out of  timeouts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Georgia Tech quarterback fakes to his fullback, hands off to his TAILBACK on the countertrap. The tailback runs behind his big, pulling tackle, both right at Lattimer.  Lattimer takes on the tackle, sheds his block. The back l his head, starts to power into Lattimer. Lattimer lets ou fierce yell. Smash! Lattimer explodes into the tailback, the collision lifting the back off the ground, whiplashing his neck,  vibrating his helmet. Lattimer's legs churn, driving the  tailback back and into the ground. We see the back's face There are snot bubbles in his nose. No first down. No way Lattimer jabs both arms in the air. The crowd goes nuts, the defense slaps helmets, and runs off the field, windmi their arms, whipping up the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: SIDELINE
dialogues.text: Winters congratulates the defense as it comes off the fie He meets Lattimer, looks into his eyes. Sees the steroids there. He knows it's the only way the kid could have done it. Decides not to bust him. Lattimer knows it. Winters g his helmet a little slap, more in sympathy than praise.

dialogues.speaker: THE YELLOW JACKET PUNTER
dialogues.text: He catches the snap, boots the ball away. Darnell fields it at his 12, starts toward the right side where hemmed in, he looks like dead meat. Suddenly, he  reverses his field, racing for the opposite sideline, whe a picket line of blockers awaits him, if he can get there He turns on the jets, barely beating two tacklers to the  corner, and then turns it up the left sideline, picking u wicked series of crack-back blocks, until he's finally ru out of bounds at the Yellow Jacket 35 yard line.

dialogues.speaker: ON STANDS
dialogues.text: The E.S.U. fans are on their feet. Winters races over to  Joe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time for 2 plays. If it's not open  in the end zone, take the sideline.  As the offense runs onto the field,  Winters checks the scoreboard. 17  seconds left. Georgia Tech 10. E.S.U.  7.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe brings the Wolves up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ball on the Yellow Jacket 35. 17  seconds left. Kane barking signals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe takes the snap, drops to pass, finds no one, rolls aw from the rush. Just as he's about to go out of bounds, he fires a bullet down the sideline. Ray Griffen catches it goes out of bounds at the twelve.

dialogues.speaker: SIDELINE
dialogues.text: Joe runs over to Coach Winters, knowing they have no more time outs, as the refs move the chains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Field goal here ties it, but a tie  may not get the Wolves into a bowl.  Tough decision for Winters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Joe) You want me to send in the kicking  team or you think you can handle it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me the ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O.K., let's do 24 inside slot, left  blue lightning.

dialogues.speaker: ON FIELD
dialogues.text: Joe races back out onto the field and into the huddle, as the crowd's roar goes off the charts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in huddle) O.K., 24 inside slot, left blue  lightning. Let's put the women and  children to bed, and go lookin' for  fuckin' dinner. On 2.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts the wolf howl. The others join in, howling for they're worth, eleven jacked-up warriors. They clap and b the huddle. The crowd is standing, waving fists in unison toward the  Georgia Tech end zone. Joe looks up in the stands again a the seat he left for his father. It's still empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This one's for you, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe starts to call signals as Bud Lite sings "Bali Hi." W go to SLOW MOTION as the ball is snapped. The Georgia Tech defense fires off the line, throwing  everything at Joe. Joe drops back five steps. Bud Lite pi up a blitzing linebacker, knocks him over a fallen player Joe looks for Darnell in the corner, but another pass rus breaks through, forcing Joe out of the pocket. It's warti as tackles and blockers collide, hand-fight, go down, scr up, collide again, all in pursuit of Joe. Darnell, realizing Joe's in trouble, breaks off his patte and heads to the center of the end zone. Joe dodges one  tackler, shakes free of another's ankle tackle, heads bac for the center of the field. He spots Darnell breaking be defensive backs. Just as he's buried by two massive linem Joe fires a rocket down the middle toward the sliver of o space that Darnell is heading for. The ball barely clears the hands of a lunging linebacker. Darnell and two defensive backs, one from each side, clos on the ball as it cuts through the air, a perfect spiral. Darnell dives. The two defensive backs dive. The ball pas between their outstretched hands by a fraction of an inch landing in Darnell's. He clutches it to his chest, rolls  over, holds the ball up for the ref to see. Touchdown! Th time Darnell does go into his touchdown dance.

dialogues.speaker: STANDS
dialogues.text: Pandemonium. The crowd including Autumn and her dad goes  crazy. Winters just gives a few quick nods, watching almo wistfully as the players and coaches hug each other, know none of them will hug him. Joe, Bud and the others mob  Darnell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alvin listens to the celebration a few beats, then switch off the radio, knowing this is an experience he'll never a part of again. We leave him staring off into an uncerta future.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Chancellor and his guests are celebrating the victory congratulating each other. Conspicuous among them are the Fat Cat Alumnus who gave Darnell the money, and the Chair of the Board of Regents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like the Timberwolves are back.  Probably brought the library with  them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hope so. (turning to Galen  Howard) Give my sincere congratulations to  Coach Winters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll be delighted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Fat Cat Alumnus goes to a replica of the Building Fun football field and starts advancing the ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 15,10, touchdown!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This brings applause all around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Darnell comes off the field, Autumn runs out and hugs  him, leads him to her dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy, you remember Darnell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I do. Great catch, Darnell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, sir. I got somethin' for  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darnell reaches into his helmet and takes out a sweat-sta piece of paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My entrance exam. Got a 92. Coach  Winters said you got an 87. He looked  it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) I'll kill him.

dialogues.speaker: JOE KANE
dialogues.text: walking toward the tunnel, acknowledging the plaudits of fans. He looks for Camille, doesn't see her. Coach Winter comes up next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell of a throw, Joe. Good to see  you back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winters gives him a quick, but firm hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And don't worry about the Heisman.  We'll gear up for it next year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe manages a weary smile.

dialogues.speaker: BUD LITE
dialogues.text: coming down the tunnel, Bobby Collins next to him. Both s as Louanne walks toward them. Bobby smiles to himself in  anticipation of her fawning over him. She walks right by and up to Bud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You still feel like gettin' a beer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud smiles. Bobby quickly looks around for someone else t hit on, hails a cheerleader. Bud and Louanne walk off  together. Louanne stops when she sees her father, fearful his reaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not a football player any more.  He's graduating this year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's still got a bowl game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louanne waits, not sure whether her father's angry or not

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So make sure he doesn't violate  curfew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louanne smiles. Winters returns it, and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE LATTIMER
dialogues.text: Sitting on the bench, his head in his hands, weeping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An amazing conclusion to a great  season. We can see Steve Lattimer  down on the bench weeping tears of  joy as E.S.U. goes back to a bowl  for the first time in three years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These are not tears of joy, but a man/boy who knows he'll never be able to play pro football without steroids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe sits on a bench at the intersection of four convergin Quad paths. Camille approaches from the opposite directio stops when she sees Joe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doin' here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waitin' for you. I figured you'de  have to come through here on your  way to dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This softens, relaxes her a bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shouldn't you be out celebrating?  You played real well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need your help with somethin'. I  know I'm not your favorite guy right  now, but it's all startin' again.  The expectations, the pressure, the  talk about the Heisman next year. I  was wonderin' if you'de like to go  somewhere, maybe share a six-pack  with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camille's shocked that he might be drinking again. He pul a six pack of 7-Up out from behind his back. She laughs i spite of herself. They settle again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I miss you, Camille. I don't like  bein' without you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll think about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at each other a beat, come forward into a long  kiss and embrace as we pull up and back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coach Winters, flanked by Humes and Clayton, walks down t tunnel to a waiting car. No effigy this time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tickets are in your coat. Itinerary  and player profiles in the briefcase.  We got a 9:00am tomorrow in Baltimore  with the kid from Park. Then we're  on to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They continue down the tunnel toward a new recruiting sea another year in the annals of The Program.
